tests.explanation: The original program correctly finds and returns the last index of 0 in the given input array, which is 2. However, the mutant program always sets index to the current index i if the value of x[i] is not 0, which means that it will return the index of the last non-zero element instead. In this case, the mutant program returns 1 instead of the correct output of 2.

This test case checks if the program can handle negative numbers and zeros in the input array correctly. The original program returns the correct output of 5, which is the index of the last 0 in the array. However, the mutant program returns 2 instead, which is the index of the last non-zero number in the array.

This test case checks if the program can handle the case where the input array does not contain any zeros correctly. The original program correctly returns -1 to indicate that no 0 is found in the array. However, the mutant program incorrectly returns 3, which is the index of last non-zero number in the array.
